website_summaries.verdict: This good-looking fanless hybrid works as a slim Windows tablet or an ultra-portable laptop, but still suffers from the same awkward marriage of base and screen as many hybrids.
pros: The Asus Transformer Book T300 Chi makes good use of Intel's low-power Core M processor, and includes a keyboard dock that works attached or remotely
The screen has a better-than-HD resolution
cons: Performance and battery life is still not on par with what other slim hybrids and laptops deliver
Some design quirks, such as a poorly placed power button, can get in the way

customer_reviews.title: Solid 2-in-1. Beautifylly built. Perplexing Bluetooth-only keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid 2-in-1, a joy to use, but ASUS decision to tether the keyboard to the tablet exclusively with Bluetooth keeps me from giving it 5-stars. The keyboard and tablet physically dock together, but ASUS doesn't take any advantage of this fact. At the very least, the keyboard should charge from the tablet without needing a separate cable, but it would be even better if the keyboard acted like physically attached keyboard and USB hub when docked--and gave access to at least one full-sized USB-A port. I simply don't understand this design decision in an otherwise excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works very well, very well made. The tablet portion is super thin and light, when compared to surface 3 is about1/3 to 1/2 in thickness which is simply amazing! I ran a torture test with power setting at performance and disable sleep /hibernation.ran out for 3 days straight and the back is still cool, tells me this machine /cpu runs very reliably. The one con is there is no connection between the tablet and the keyboard, so you have to charge separately and the keyboard doesn't have any additional ports.
customer_reviews.author: Jianre Hsiung

customer_reviews.title: We have had no issues and set up was pretty simple. My only complaint so far is the ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet/laptop was a gift for my wife. So far it seems to be performing well. We have had no issues and set up was pretty simple. My only complaint so far is the charging is a little cumbersome for the keyboard portion. The tablet receives the power from the wall. Then a micro usb runs from the right side of the tablet around to the left side of the keyboard. It makes an otherwise slick machine look a little cluttered. That is the reason I held back one star.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Well when that's work but very fragile
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for 18 months and abruptly stopped turning on. Asus asks $ 350 to repair it since it is no longer under warranty. Since it is a tablet, everything is welded and it is impossible to repair it at home. This tablet is usually much more fragile than my older laptops (which are still working very well).
customer_reviews.author: Adrien

customer_reviews.title: This is a great replacement for my previous tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replacement for my previous tablet. This is much more than a tablet, and fits in almost the same sorts of space. It lets you do real work on a very portable device, rather than either sacrificing functionality for portability, or the other way around. I am a linux user, and dumped everything on the hard drive the day I got it, so cannot respond to any software issues on the machine with Windows. I can say that, once I got things configured correctly, it works flawlessly with linux, even the touchscreen and bluetooth keyboard. I won't be without this.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: DIED IN THE MIDDLE OF A TRIP
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months this device just turned off and I was not able to turn it on back again. Charge was ok, software was ok and no physical damage nor bad happened at any time. We are in the middle of a trip in abroad (this was suppose to be a good travel companion device, btw) and even after reading blogs for hours I was left with no options to deal with this. AVOID PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Valverde

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the shipping box and this was taped to the package. "Please DO NOT upgrade to Windows 10. This product is not compatible with Windows 10." What the heck? Update, there was no problem with upgrading to windows 10 and I love this tablet. It's super light and works great. Ignore the warning sheet if you get one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Yandle

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop that can be used as a tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love it! The screen is amazing and the touch screen works perfectly. Handwritten recognition is perfect. The only complaint there is no surface plan rejection. The battery life is excellent as is the keyboard. When attached you can't even tell it can separate but once you separate it it is a tablet through and through. It boots fast and works great, I basically use it for reading pdf's, using office and web browsing. I store things on the cloud so not having storage space is ok. Great investment if you want a laptop that is completely portable and can be used as a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: it is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: got this tablet/comp the same day it came out. it is great for the price. I use it mainly for school/work stuff and it hasn't slowed down one bit. the small keyboard is sometimes annoying I guess and it could be faster.
customer_reviews.author: mfva

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This lap top has great potential but it comes with windows 7 which doesn't work with anything any more and so you have to upgrade to windows 10 which costs money. Then when I upgraded to windows 10 the computer wouldn't connect to the keyboard anymore. I had to get help to reconnect it and then it disconnected again. It has been nothing but trouble and definitely not worth $425 that I paid. I wish I had returned it when I first realized it ran on windows 7!
customer_reviews.author: Pinklady

customer_reviews.title: Really upsetting as I enjoy this design quite a lot
customer_reviews.text: Seriously lacking in the RAM department. I'm not sure why the 8GB RAM model isn't available. Really upsetting as I enjoy this design quite a lot. Runs Linux mostly okay, although the bluetooth keyboard and trackpad somehow do not support multitouch gestures (like two finger scrolling) out of the box. I returned mine and forked up an extra $200 ($599 when I bought it at the end of November) for a Lenovo Ideapad[...]which I very much prefer.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed because I have had good luck with ASUS products ...
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is constantly losing Bluetooth connectivity with the main tablet. There is no hard wire communication connection between the two, so with the Bluetooth failing, the keyboard is unusable. I'm going to try to get some support from ASUS. I'm very disappointed because I have had good luck with ASUS products in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great so far,  battery needs to be charged quite often.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 months. I love the size, perfect to put in my backpack to school. I have had zero problems so far. The only negative is the battery does not last long and the charger is not the type I can charge with my portable battery pack. So if you are not going to be near a plug in this might not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: RChase

customer_reviews.title: They sold me a DEFECTIVE device and got away with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device from this seller (BuyTek) last year. It was DEFECTIVE. It did not connect to WiFi due to some harware defect. I had to leave the country immediately. So I couldn't return the item at that time. I emailed the seller, and asked for help. His instructions were totally helpless. When I returned to the contry and asked the seller for return/replacement, they denied the request because it was "a couple of days" after the return period. So, this seller sold me a DEFECTIVE device and got away with it.
customer_reviews.author: Morvarid

customer_reviews.title: great machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: love it! this computer is perfect for my purposes, simple web browsing, occasional youtube & netflix streaming and contract write ups and pdf creations. this is an awesome little machine, only complaint i have is the same as most every other review. the battery life leaves something to be desired roughly 4-5 hours but i always carry a portable battery/ and or am always close to an outlet, so crisis averted. if you really dont have access to a power source every 4-5 hours then you should spend the extra 200-300 bucks for a machine with longer battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ryan

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: 4 months after purchasing this product it's stopped working on me twice. The screen goes dark and no amount of pushing the power button can get it back on. A month after getting it back from ASUS repair service the same problem has risen again. I highly recommend looking elsewhere for a 2-in-1 touchscreen PC.
customer_reviews.author: Ohireime Eromosele

customer_reviews.title: Great 2in1
customer_reviews.text: Great computer i purchased for online schooling. So far windows 8.1 is working great since it has an actual touch screen to use with all those large buttons and icons. I recommend the asus pen for it, i purchased mine off the asus store. The 4 star review is due to the lack of pen and some occasional issues with keyboard connectivity and the track pad being a bit tough to use.
customer_reviews.author: MT Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Two small, and hardware issue within one month with ...
customer_reviews.text: Two small, and hardware issue within one month with Intel wifi wireless adapter , luckily under warranty. returned, went with larger hp laptop instead.
customer_reviews.author: cara F

customer_reviews.title: It comes with windows 8!
customer_reviews.text: No regular usb port. Not a fan of the bluetooth keyboard. And it's a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Surface killer
customer_reviews.text: It's really fast for such a low end processor. I guess the SSD is a screamer. Much thiner than a surface pro, and half the price;) Cons: It's hard to open once it's closed. Thought the battery would last longer. I was recommending it to someone that needed a front facing camera.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Antec

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard worked 50% of the time, bit of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard worked 50% of the time, bit of a pain to setup. USB failed right after it was no longer under warranty. Second ASUS to have that happen. Look it up, common issue with all ASUS laptops. Last one I buy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed purchase on this windows tablet, not cheap, charger pin broke off inside tablet after the 1st initial charge... Fortunately I am returning for a full refund. Apparently quality isnt their thang :-(
customer_reviews.author: Dana Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good 2n1
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 2n1 for about 2 yrs now. It has performed very well for me. It would have been better if it would charge the keyboard everytime you charge the tablet instead of running a separate cord to it. Battery life is not great, but suffices.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: It has a few quirks but on the whole good.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this little tablet/laptop. The battery life isn't as good as the T100 but it charges much quicker. One issue is that the keyboard doesn't charge when you charge the tablet; they are two separate entities. There is a male-to-male micro usb in the box for plugging the laptop into the keyboard to charge it but this is very faffy. For a relatively cheap transformer with goodish specs it does the job well if not perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for editing photos -- even professional use
customer_reviews.text: Display is great -- I use it for processing photos. I run Photoshop CC, Dynamic Photo HDR, and Topaz Labs on it and convert the day's shots from RAW images to JPG. It's not as fast as my i7 laptop -- its processor M-5Y10 scores 2,886 at cpubenchmark.net vs. my laptop's i7-4710HQ's 7,843 -- but so much thinner and lighter that I carry it everyday along with my camera gear.
customer_reviews.author: Virgelio Carpio

customer_reviews.title: Quick review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Met all my expectations and requirements! Super quiet! Thin Easy to switch between tablet and laptop Installed Windows 10 and it handles it fantastically Lightning fast Cons: Keys don't light up It's understandably top heavy Requires two separate charger types: DC IN for tablet, micro usb for keyboard (they don't charge off each other. Short battery life (charge nightly) Final Verdict: Favorite device in the house! Glad I chose it.
customer_reviews.author: John Norman

customer_reviews.title: Very fine computer. Lightweight and not bulky like laptops are ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fine computer. Lightweight and not bulky like laptops are normally.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I still have to figure out what it can all do but I love that it is a tablet and laptop
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday present in July. I still have to figure out what it can all do but I love that it is a tablet and laptop. It makes it easier to take anywhere. Its a perfect size as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli S.

customer_reviews.title: Wifi not functioning, highly not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I struggled using it to read news and surf the Internet. It was constantly interrupted from loss of wifi connection. The wifi keyboard sometimes does not respond well. For a SSD drive, it feels kind of slow. The tablet back gets hot shortly after you charged it. Not recommending to anyone to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great device. Very slim and works well as both
customer_reviews.text: It's a great device. Very slim and works well as both, tablet and laptop. Battery life is decent. Don't expect much from the speakers, but with headphones it's great for movies and/or music. Windows 10 upgrade working well. I've been using it for about a month and the keyboard still has not needed to be charged since new. Paired it with a Logitech Bluetooth mouse and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo B. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Tried and True
customer_reviews.text: Really nice. Works well. compact and easy to carry. ASUS has proven to be a good product. I have 3 ASUS products and have not had a problem over the last 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: VStan

customer_reviews.title: Asus Transformer T300 Chi
customer_reviews.text: I am still getting to know it. I ordered it to replace my notebooks full of sheet music. It does not come with any decent software just the stuff Microsoft wants you to buy into. It has a very clear picture for videos.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Daly

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but not practical for me. Have replaced it with a more functional laptop/notebook.
customer_reviews.text: Note book crapped out after a week of use. Too many necessary cable connections to make it work as a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: The quality of a Surface at a much better price
customer_reviews.text: I am an IT professional and most of the time I'm disappointed when I buy a notebook. However, not in this case. I'm well pleased with every aspect of this machine. It's weight, thin sleek design and very clever mechanism using rarr earth metales to detach/re-attach the display. I would recommend however if you have small hands to go with the smaller display size.Every bit as good as the Surface but for much cheaper I'm pushing to replace our companies Surface's with the Chi next fiscal year!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great great great
customer_reviews.text: This is by far that best computer I have ever owned. The picture is amazing, it's the perfect size, and it's perfect for school, work, and play. Highly recommend this computer. I did A LOT of research on finding the best computer at a reasonable price and I'm glad I took the time to do so. I can also pay it over 6 months with no interest...that's a big plus for me!
customer_reviews.author: Manda Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: The best portable tablet laptop combo. It won't run extreme games or apps but that's not it's primary purpose. Everything runs wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: IT Professional + Life Professional

customer_reviews.title: We are quite pleased with these both as mini-laptops and tablets
customer_reviews.text: We brought two and one had to be replaced under warranty - our fault. Upgraded to Windows 10 without problem. We are quite pleased with these both as mini-laptops and tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Gowen

customer_reviews.title: very shakey
customer_reviews.text: on time, as described I am editing this review. After 6 months of low use, This item stopped working, doesn't turn on, won't take a charge and happened overnight during normal use and no adverse events.
customer_reviews.author: jnichols

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Does not charge or work, and I’ve bought 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: LJS209

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!! I loved it at all especially in tablet mode.
customer_reviews.text: Compact design,Aluminum body, Outstanding slim screen IPS and responsive touch and high brightness, Core M processor>>fast and reliable performance, SSD Storage, Sound is good and clear and battery life is excellent...Perfect I loved it at all especially as a tablet mode. Cons: Micro USB and HDMI .
customer_reviews.author: Safy

customer_reviews.title: High Quality at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This was an unexpectedly awesome laptop. It is a much higher end laptop than I expected. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great, just what I was looking for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff, just upgrade drivers and BIOS and there you go. Best for always being on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good battery life in regular usage
customer_reviews.text: A different experience, tablet and notebook at the same time :) Ultra slim, good battery life in regular usage, CPU is not too bad, ssd is really fast and you can feel the difference with the conventional HDD...
customer_reviews.author: Ulas Canbolat

customer_reviews.title: Working out pretty good but am afraid to move up to Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: Working out pretty good but am afraid to move up to Windows 10 with it, though. Did that with a T100TA and never could get the system to work again. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: bluetooth keyboard does not pair with tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth keyboard docking does not pair with tablet .. I'm a techie .. frustrated , tried everything. send it back
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The charging port for the keyboard stopped working. I had to replace it with a new one from ebay.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A very good laptop!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this laptop. Works fast and properly. The keyboard is really convenient for me. No problems with seeing the keyboard or with wi-fi as some reviews reported. I really advise it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and is working great, but it is a little on the heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and is working great, but it is a little on the heavy side and the charging of the keyboard is a little awkward and inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Keoki Noji

customer_reviews.title: Great and fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great and fast delivery. Works perfectly for my needs. Would NEVER go back to a non-touch screen computer again.
customer_reviews.author: DenCimm

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gave out after 4 mo dont buy this or from retaler...
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well and very handy. Use when I travel or read or send and check emails. worth every penny/
customer_reviews.author: Lucky D

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. No international waranty
customer_reviews.text: It suddently stopped working. Only lasted for 6 months. Went to sleep mode and never woke up again. Piece of crap. No international waranty.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastián Hollmann

customer_reviews.title: photo finish
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. I am writing my college paper on it now. Being able to detach the tablet and read my books, then attach the keyboard and type the paper is just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER R PALMERIO

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for one day, then the keyboard died. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: the keyboard was not working in a short time since ...
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard was not working in a short time since i got the computer and the warranty is provided from Taiwan, can't find any asus repair company in here.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard woked for 2 months. No one will help!!!
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard stopped working 1 month after the return policy ended (1 month return policy). Amazon would do nothing. Asus wasn't Abe to help either. Now stuck with no keyboard. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Aarika

customer_reviews.title: VERY IMPORTANT
customer_reviews.text: IF THE KEYBOARD IS NOT WORKING, YOU HAVE TO CHARGE IT WITH A PHONE CHARGER
customer_reviews.author: Mohaddaseh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product overall. Would like to0be able to add ram.after fact. Great touch screen
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my wife. She absolutely loves this device.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Grafton

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten one with a bad wifi issue, because it could not keep a wifi signal to save it's life. It's also a weird screen ratio when holding it like a tablet. It's a cool idea, but definitely still has a way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mat Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very easily detachable.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Asus products as well. But this one is a steal for its price compared to surface pro or dell xps with touchscreen, Intel processors and 4GB RAM. Unlike surface pro, you don't have to pay for the keyboard. Docking is very sleek and smooth. But be careful when you walk around docked. Very easily detachable.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the laptop it is nice and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great no problems to far
customer_reviews.text: I use this computer daily at work for meetings and on the go, works great no problems to far. Pros: Quick performance, quick startup, keyboards great, holds a charge 8-9 hours with heavy use. Negs: touch pad can be finicky, recommend using a mouse, cases are almost none existent.
customer_reviews.author: Satellite_no

customer_reviews.title: Machine died after only 1 year of use. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Machine died after only 1 year of use. The micro usb port little plastic was missing so probably short circuited the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Groenewold

customer_reviews.title: Great refurbished product!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to Windows 10 and it works perfect! I'm so glad I bought refurbished instead of new!
customer_reviews.author: Zomlies

customer_reviews.title: This was the worse piece of electronics I ever owned. Pure waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worse piece of electronics I ever owned. I bought it because I wanted something small. It used it for about a week and left for Europe for 4 months. When I got there I used it for one day and it worked fine but I let the battery run out of power. I could never turn it back on. I took it to two repair chops. No one was able to make it start and I was told that there were multiple shorts in the mother board. By the time I got back, 4 months later, the warranty had expired. I spent over $400 for NOTHING. It was pure waste!!!!!!! I am NOT HAPPY about this!
customer_reviews.author: M-H

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I ought to have returned it. heavy, dark screen, speakers suck
customer_reviews.author: vlmillard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Highly recommended for college students. It is light and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Regina Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Lets just say the new macbook gets way better battery life
customer_reviews.text: Lets just say the new macbook gets way better battery life. Battery life is mediocre. Ignoring the batter life (which is ok) the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Chapman

customer_reviews.title: $100. restocking fee for a product that broke TWICE? Really?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product twice. Both times the keyboard burned out. It is a piece of junk. Then charged $95.00 restocking fee??? I am very disappointed and won't order through this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Uhlman

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK, but essentially a scam.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 365 days and 6 hours, then developed screen issue "out of warranty".
customer_reviews.author: Hamotron

customer_reviews.title: Computer was very good in terms of functionality however it looked someone's Id ...
customer_reviews.text: Computer was very good in terms of functionality however it looked someone's Id in there even through I ordered new. It does not turn on after I used it for few weeks. So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Youngsoo Choi

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Where is the documentation for general use and functions!! The keyboard and the tablet must be seperately charged. Not all charging equipment seems to be included. The tablet seems very fragile and, in my opinion, is clumsy when used as a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Micro USB Port Not Working
customer_reviews.text: The laptop usb port is not working, and I tried with different adapters, could you tell me how to resolve this?
customer_reviews.author: rgap

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth to keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased last week and keyboard won't Bluetooth to the tablet leaving it virtually useless. Trying to figure it out but very frustrated that I even have to mess with it. More to follow but want it on record in the event this cannot be rectified.
customer_reviews.author: Cauveren

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The screen froze and the screen also wasnt stable. do not buy , overheats easily
customer_reviews.author: Jing Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop, horrible windows.
customer_reviews.text: Nice laptop, but it has windows 8 like most do these days. No one should buy a computer with windows 8, it's riddled with problems. Ive had it for only a few weeks, and the wifi already doesnt work. Now I have to completely reinstall windows and if that doesn't fix the problem then I am returning this laptop and building my own with windows 7. Windows has become a piece of s***.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: ASUS Transformer Book Chi 12.5-Inch T300CHI-F1-DB Slim All-Aluminum 2 in 1 Detachable Touchscreen Laptop, Core M, 4 GB RAM, 128 GB SSD
product_meta.description:
ASUS Transformer Book T300CHI-F1-DB 12.5" IPS FHD 1920x1080 Touch screenscreen, Corning Concore Glass, Supports Synaptic Pressure Sensitive Stylus (256 Pressure Levels). Intel Core M 5Y10 Processor with 4M shared L3 cache, Turbo Boost up to 2.00 GHz. 4GB DDR3 on board RAM, 128GB iSSD, Dual-Band 802.11ABGN, Bluetooth 4.0. Windows 8.1, Unlimited ASUS Webstorage for 1 Year.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 12.5" ASUS TruVivid Display with IPS technology, 1920-by-1080 resolution. Corning Concore Glass.
Support for ASUS Active Stylus Pen (256 pressure levels).
Intel Core M Processor with 4M shared L3 cache, Turbo Boost up to 2.00 GHz. 4GB RAM.
128GB iSSD. Unlimited ASUS WebStorage (1 year free)
Dual-band 802.11N Wifi for fast web browsing. Support for Miracast. Bluetooth 4.0.
1x Micro USB 3.0, 1x Micro HDMI, 1x Headphone-Mic Combo jack. Micro SD card reader (SDXC).
All-Alumnium .3-Inch Slim Unibody Construction. Revolutionary Neodymium Magnetic Hinge. 8-Hours Battery Life.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars173 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
